explanation:
The report is correct. lfs_mlist_isopen does not modify the list or the nodes it traverses, so both parameters can and should be const-qualified to satisfy MISRA C:2023 Rule 8.13. The current signature
  static bool lfs_mlist_isopen(struct lfs_mlist *head, struct lfs_mlist *node)
uses non-const pointers and even takes the address of the parameter (&head) as a struct lfs_mlist **, which forces the non-const types in the current implementation. This is a local implementation choice, not a limitation of the API: a simple rewrite that uses a single-pointer traversal (for (const struct lfs_mlist *p = head; p; p = p->next) { if (p == node) ... }) allows the signature to be changed to
  static bool lfs_mlist_isopen(const struct lfs_mlist *head, const struct lfs_mlist *node)
without loss of functionality. Passing non-const pointers to const parameters is allowed, so existing call sites (including the shown lfs_file_read) will continue to work (and the explicit cast in lfs_file_read would become unnecessary). Therefore the reported MISRA 8.13 violation is valid and the function should be const-corrected.
